name: emasculation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal the process of making a man feel less male by taking away his power and confidence: Some male commentators on cable TV mocked her voice as shrill or joked about emasculation. The programme portrays every cliché of working-class manhood and emasculation.
biology
  specialized the act of castrating (= removing the male sexual parts of) a man or male animal, or removing the male parts of a plant: When it comes to neutering their male animals, squeamish men project their own fear of emasculation onto their animals.
formal the fact of making something less effective or reducing its power: He was committed to eliminating corruption and what he called the emasculation of civil institutions. The emasculation of the police force has created a feeling of insecurity. See
emasculate
More examplesFewer examplesDespite the emasculation of today's male, manliness remains a characteristic embedded in the modern male personality.Damaging budget cuts have included the emasculation of the education budget.After emasculation, the colt was rested for a couple of weeks.
